content: Yes, the lifespan of swans can be increased through conservation and habitat management efforts. Swans require healthy and abundant wetland habitats with clean water, sufficient food sources, and protection from predators and human disturbance. By restoring and protecting wetlands, conservation efforts can help to maintain and improve the health and survival of swan populations. Additionally, efforts to reduce pollution and other threats to swans, such as hunting and habitat loss, can also help to increase their lifespan.
